content.webTitle: CD: Scouting for Girls, Scouting for Girls

fields.headline: Scouting for Girls, Scouting for Girls
fields.bodyText: Their name might be a cheeky wink to Baden Powell's gang of explorers, but Scouting for Girls' music is more of a tiresome ramble than a thrilling adventure. Welded to a love of breezy Britpop, the Harrow three-piece are the definition of easy listening, with soft drums, bass and piano fluttering around lovesick letters written to a girl gone awol. It's Not About You describes the circumstances in which she got up one morning and left for a year, Keep on Walking is just one of many pleas for her to return. Even I Need a Holiday, which neatly sums up the frustrations of the nine-to-fiver, eventually turns into another ode to "the one". The melodies and harmonies are almost indistinguishable, and the hidden track, a love song to pretty, inoffensive, endlessly enthusiastic but terminally bland kids TV presenter Michaela Strachan, sums up this debut.
